text: Elizabeth Furse (October 13, 1936 â€“ April 18, 2021) was a Kenya Colony-born American businesswoman and politician. She was a member of the United States House of Representatives from 1993 to 1999, representing Oregon's 1st congressional district. She was a Democrat. She was the first naturalized U.S. citizen born in Africa to win election to the United States Congress.Institute for Tribal Government Biography from the Portland State University website Furse died on April 18, 2021, at age 84, at her farm near Hillsboro, Oregon from problems caused by a fall. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:People from Nairobi Category:United States representatives from Oregon Category:Businesspeople from Oregon Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Elizabeth Furse
